name: isofld
body: |- wb(wcel(c0, cofld), wa(wcel(c0, cfield), wcel(c0, corng)))

body.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, cofld), wa(wcel(c0, cfield), wcel(c0, corng)))
-| wceq(cofld, cin(cfield, corng))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ oField ↔(c0 ∈ Field ∧ c0 ∈ oRing))
⊣ oField =(Field ⋂ oRing)

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, cofld), wa(wcel(c0, cfield), wcel(c0, corng)))
-| wceq(cofld, cin(cfield, corng))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ oField ↔(c0 ∈ Field ∧ c0 ∈ oRing))
⊣ oField =(Field ⋂ oRing)

cumulated.origin: |- wb(wcel(c0, cofld), wa(wcel(c0, cfield), wcel(c0, corng)))

comment: An ordered field is a field with a total ordering compatible with its operations. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 23-Mar-2018.)
